title: MTV News shut down as Paramount Global cuts 25% of its staff
description: Paramount Global, the parent company of networks including Showtime, CBS and Nickelodeon is cutting some 25% of its staff. Among the units being shutdown as a result of the downsizing is MTV News.

title: When it comes to cars, there is no housing crisis (just an existential one)
description: One man makes the case that Americans' pursuit of abundant parking is upending our cities and our lives.

title: Sen. Dianne Feinstein is set to return to Washington Tuesday following an absence
description: Feinstein, 89, will return to work Tuesday after being away for months to recover from shingles, her office says. She last voted in February, and her absence has spurred calls for her to resign.

title: An Arizona lawmaker (who is also a minister) is under investigation for a Bible prank
description: An ethics inquiry is examining whether Democratic state Rep. Stephanie Stahl-Hamilton, a Presbyterian minister, broke Arizona House rules when she hid Bibles from the members' lounge in a protest.

title: A jury finds Trump liable for battery and defamation in E. Jean Carroll trial
description: Jurors believed that Carroll's allegation of sexual abuse in a Manhattan department store in the mid-1990s was more likely true than not. They awarded her $5 million in total damages.

title: Senate Democrats demand more details from Harlan Crow on gifts to Justice Thomas
description: Top Senate Democrats are pushing for new disclosures from a wealthy GOP donor with ties to Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas.

title: 'Paved Paradise' examines how parking has changed the American landscape
description: Author Henry Grabar says parking codes, parking lots and garages have shaped the landscape of cities and suburbs, and limited the creation of affordable housing.

title: LGBTQ+ couples in India await the Supreme Court's decision on same-sex marriage
description: In a landmark case, a group of 18 Indian couples has petitioned the country's Supreme Court to legalize same-sex marriage. Arguments are wrapping up this week and a decision is expected this summer.

title: Texas Army base Fort Hood is renamed for Hispanic 4-star general Richard Cavazos
description: The redesignation of the installation is part of the military's larger effort to rename bases and other sites associated with the Confederacy. Cavazos is the Army's first Hispanic four-star general.

title: If you're 40, it's time to start mammograms, according to new guidelines
description: The influential U.S. Preventive Task Force issue a draft of its new breast cancer screening guidelines. They're now recommending women start younger, amid a rise in breast cancer rates.

title: Putin assails West for unleashing 'real war' against Russia, as it marks Victory Day
description: Russia's victory day ceremony was scaled back this year, amid the war in Ukraine

title: Trailblazing opera star Grace Bumbry dies at age 86
description: The celebrated singer, who led an illustrious, jet-setting  career, broke the color barrier as the first Black artist to perform at Germany's Bayreuth Festival.

title: Imran Khan, former Pakistan prime minister, arrested in Islamabad
description: Khan was arrested by an anti-corruption unit outside a court in the capital Islamabad where he was facing corruption charges

title: Imran Khan, Pakistan's former prime minister, is arrested in Islamabad
description: Paramilitary forces arrested Khan at a court in Islamabad, where he was facing corruption charges. The arrest has triggered rare pushback against the military, the country's most powerful institution.

title: Swastika Mountain is renamed Mount Halo in honor of a historical tribal leader
description: The mountain in Oregon and a nearby town, no longer in existence, were named Swastika more than 100 years ago after a local ranch that bore the same name.

title: Maternity homes provide support in a post-Roe world, but not without conditions
description: A crisis pregnancy center in Idaho opened a maternity home in the months after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade. The residents have more complicated stories than the home's founders expected.

title: Ex-federal judge: Congress should pass a code of conduct for the Supreme Court
description: NPR's A Martinez talks to retired federal judge Michael Luttig about his call for Congress to pass a code of conduct for Supreme Court justices. He talks about the strict rules he followed as a judge.

title: He followed strict rules as a judge, and wants Supreme Court justices to do the same
description: Retired federal judge Michael Luttig says he wouldn't even accept baseball tickets in his years on the bench: "I believe that federal judges should essentially live like priests or saints or monks."

title: The FDA considers first birth control pill without a prescription
description: The Food and Drug Administration is weighing whether to allow a birth control pill to be sold over the counter for the first time. An advisory committee opens a two-day hearing Tuesday.

title: President Biden hosts top congressional leaders at White House to talk debt limit
description: It's unlikely that Tuesday afternoon's meeting will yield drastically different responses from any of the players. Still, the June 1 deadline — when the government could run short of money — looms.

title: Fox isn't in the apology business. That could cost it a ton of money
description: Fox Corp. CEO Lachlan Murdoch will address investors Tuesday. He isn't likely to apologize for the events that led to a $787-million settlement over the broadcasting of election-related falsehoods.

title: Many people living in the 'Diabetes Belt' are plagued with medical debt
description: More than half of the counties in the nation's so-called Diabetes Belt also have high rates of medical debt among their residents, an NPR analysis found.

title: Florida lawmakers want to use radioactive material to pave roads
description: Phosphogypsum, a byproduct in the fertilizer industry, contains uranium and radium — which as the EPA notes,  forms radon, "a cancer-causing, radioactive gas."

title: 'Wild Dances' puts consequences of a long-ago, faraway conflict at center
description: By ingeniously weaving improbable and conflicting forces that make up his personal history, Eurovision expert William Lee Adams affirms an idea of home that yearns to transcend space and time.

title: Top Islamic Jihad commanders and family members are dead from Israeli strikes in Gaza
description: Palestinian health officials said 13 people were killed in all, including the commanders, their wives, several of their children and others nearby.

title: A 17-year-old died in the Outer Banks after a sand dune collapsed on top of him
description: The teenager's friends and family had been looking for him. He was found buried underneath several feet of sand.

title: In Australia, scientists begin vaccinating koalas against chlamydia
description: The safety and effectiveness of the vaccine, designed specifically for koalas, has previously been tested by vaccinating a few hundred koalas brought to wildlife rescue centers for other afflictions.

title: Buffalo Bills' Damar Hamlin says he will put the millions raised into his charity
description: The decision begins the 25-year-old's plan for the unprecedented outpouring of support that he received after his heart stopped following a tackle during a "Monday Night Football" game in January.

title: Psychologists issue health advisory for teens and social media
description: At a time of rising rates of depression and anxiety among teens, the American Psychological Association warns parents parents their children need more protection. when they are online.

title: What we know about the deadly Allen, Texas mass shooting
description: Authorities have released the victims of some of the victims killed in the mass shooting. Also, new details are emerging about the shooter's background.
